articles.title: Egyptian Businessman Here
articles.content:
Egyptian Businessman Here
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Naguib Sawiris, executive chairman of the Orascom Telecom Media and Technology Holdings SAE, and his companion arrived here on Wednesday.

articles.title: Floral Basket to mosaic depicting
articles.content:
Floral Basket to mosaic depicting
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Naguib Sawiris, executive chairman of the Orascom Telecom Media and Technology Holdings SAE, and his companion Wednesday laid a floral basket before the mosaic depicting President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il erected at the Korea Computer Centre.
					 The guests laid the floral basket before the mosaic before paying tribute to them.

articles.title: DPRK, Russia Cooperate in Preventing Illegal Fishing
articles.content:
DPRK, Russia to Cooperate in Preventing Illegal Fishing 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A DPRK-Russia intergovernmental agreement on cooperation in preventing illegal fishing was signed in Moscow on Monday. 
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were a delegation of the Ministry of Fisheries led by Minister Pak Thae Won and DPRK Ambassador to Russia Kim Yong Jae and from the Russian side Andrei Kraini, head of the Federal Agency of Fisheries, and officials concerned. 
					
					 The agreement was inked by Pak Thae Won and Andrei Kraini.

articles.title: Study Tour of Birthplace Launched in DPRK
articles.content:
Study Tour of Birthplace Launched in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- School youth and children from across the country started their study tour of leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan secret camp with the approach of the 70th anniversary of his birth. 
					 A meeting for starting the tour took place in front of the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo Memorial Tower in Hyesan of DPRK's northern province of Ryanggang on Wednesday.
					
					 The participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the tower and paid tribute to him.
					
					 At the meeting Jang Hyon Chol, secretary of the C.C., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, made a report which was followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers expressed their honor of taking part in the tour on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star and the will to more deeply grasp the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu. 
					
					 They stressed that they would glorify the immortal revolutionary careers and exploits of the great persons of Mt. Paektu with the iron faith that Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il are always with them. 
					
					 After the meeting, the study tour group started its march for Pochonbo, carrying the flags bearing the portraits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in its van.

articles.title: Participants of Study Tours Vow Their Loyalty before Birthplace
articles.content:
Participants of Study Tours Vow Their Loyalty before Birthplace 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Participants of study tours of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and the Ministry of Railways separately held meetings before general secretary Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the secret camp of Mt. Paektu on Tuesday and Wednesday to vow their loyalty on the occasion of his birth anniversary. 
					 Members of the group of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces pledged themselves to thoroughly equip themselves with the glorious revolutionary tradition of the Workers' Party of Korea established by President Kim Il Sung and developed by Kim Jong Il and grow to be reliable vanguard fighters for Songun revolution. 
					
					 A reporter and speakers at the meeting held by the participants of the study tour of the Ministry of Railways said that they recollect with deep emotion the noble revolutionary career of Kim Jong Il who was born as a son of guerrillas and performed immortal exploits for the country and the revolution, the era and history.
					
					 All the participants renewed their will to devote their wisdom and enthusiasm to building a thriving nation in the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu to honor the pledge made to the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 At the end of the meetings they went round relics preserved with deep care in the birthplace.

articles.title: Federation of Science and Technology Meets
articles.content:
Federation of Science and Technology Meets
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The 49th Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea (GFSTK) took place here on Wednesday. 
					 The meeting discussed how to implement the decision of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the joint calls of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK and the militant tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial. 
					
					 Present there were members and alternate members of the GFSTK Central Committee and officials of its affiliated organizations in Pyongyang and localities.

articles.title: Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Merited Intellectuals
articles.content:
Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Merited Intellectuals
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- State academic degrees and titles went to intellectuals who made positive contributions to building a thriving nation with big scientific and technological successes through a dynamic drive to push back the frontiers of the latest science and technology on the occasion of the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 The title of candidate academician went to Jang So Ik, teacher at Kim Il Sung University, Kim Ryon Hoe, a teacher of Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering, Ri Thae Sik, chief of an institute of the Academy of Agricultural Science, Pak U Sop, chief of a department of Hamhung University of Chemical Engineering, and the title of professor to teacher Kim Chang Ryon and researcher An Hyo Sik of Kim Il Sung University, Yun Yong Hak, chief of a department of Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University, Choe Sun Ok, room chief of the Academy of Social Sciences, and Ri Son Jong, researcher of the State Academy of Sciences. 
					
					 Doctorate went to Jong Tong Gyu, teacher of Kim Chaek University of Technology, Mun Jong Ji, vice rector of Sinuiju University of Education No. 2, Ri Kwang Il, researcher of Chongjin University of Medicine, Yun Kwang Ryong, researcher of the State Academy of Sciences, Manager Jang Myong Hak and Section Chief Kang Yong Yong of the February 8 Vinalon Complex, Son Kwang Won, vice chief engineer of the Huichon Ryonha General Machine Plant, and others and the title of associate professor to 101 people. 
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday.

articles.title: DPRK Papers Call for Working in Kim Jong Il's Way
articles.content:
DPRK Papers Call for Working in Kim Jong Il's Way
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- All the party members, servicepersons and other people should make it an iron rule of their work and life to create and make leap forward in general secretary Kim Jong Il's way as befitting the officials, party members and people trained by him.
					 Newspapers of the DPRK made this call in their editorials Wednesday.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's is the original way of work and creation whose validity and inexhaustible might had already been fully displayed in the protracted and arduous practice of the Korean revolution, Rodong Sinmun said, adding:
					
					 His way is the people-centered way of creation that calls for relying on the popular masses and giving full play to their mental power in order to push ahead with socialist construction. It is also the revolutionary way of struggle in the 21st century as it helps conduct all works in a creative and innovative manner under whatever conditions and circumstances and make uninterrupted strides.
					
					 His way represents all examples to be followed in the era of building a thriving nation, ranging from the principles of creation and construction to the mode and spirit of planning works and launching them and to style of work.
					
					 The idea of Kim Jong Il in making revolution is that of offensive and his way of revolution is that of offensive. It was his peculiar disposition to go into action rapidly, once the target is set, and dash towards the target and then continue offensive to attain higher goals.
					
					 To follow his way is the key to the everlasting victory of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean revolution and a shortcut to the building of a thriving country.
					
					 Minju Joson said: Kim Jong Il is always with us and his venerable name and image serve as the banner of the eternal victory of the DPRK.

articles.title: KCNA on U.S. New War Scenario
articles.content:
KCNA on U.S. New War Scenario 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is pushing ahead with its plan for starting a new war on the Korean Peninsula.
					 On Jan. 25 it formally signed a "plan of jointly coping with local provocation" with the south Korean puppet forces, a document for aggression which calls for mobilizing its troops present in Japan and the Pacific region in case an contingency occurs on the peninsula.
					
					 Adopted to realize the new U.S. defense strategy, this plan is evoking world public concern as it is a dangerous military movement aimed at unleashing another Korean war.
					
					 As already reported, the new defense strategy was worked out under the pretext of "cuts in military spending". Its keynote is to beef up its military forces in the Asia-Pacific region, the Korean Peninsula in particular, following cutting the number of its forces in the Mid-east and Europe.
					
					 In other word, it is intended to realize the efficiency and active mobilization of its armed forces on the premise that a new war is unleashed in the Korean peninsula following the Mid-east.
					
					 The U.S. authorities have already made it an established fact to start another war in the Korean peninsular. 
					
					This can be illustrated by recent remarks of the present U.S. chief executive and defense secretary.
					
					 As part of executing their purpose, they plan to stage the largest-ever joint military exercises such as Key Resolve, Ssangryong and Foal Eagle after massively introducing the U.S. ultramodern military hardware into south Korea.
					
					 This goes to prove that the final purpose of the above-said joint plan is to launch a large-scale military action on the Korean Peninsula, that is, a new war.
					
					 Worse still, the south Korean regime is ready to mobilize all its political, military and economic means and forces as cannon fodder for the U.S. forces and an igniter of new war any moment because it pursues a thoroughgoing U.S.-toeing policy.
					
					 This provides the U.S. with all conditions and possibility enough to ignite another Korean war unlike in Mid-east.
					
					Any trifling provocative act will lead to an all-out nuclear war, regional war and finally a new world war in the Korean Peninsula because it is the largest arsenal of nukes and other weapons in the world and there is no durable system and guarantee to avert any war in the peninsula. Accordingly, there is no need to mention a local warfare on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to ponder over the serious consequences to be entailed by their war provocation moves.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Settle Crimes Committed by It under "Resident-General" Rule
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Settle Crimes Committed by It under "Resident-General" Rule 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- It was exactly 106 years ago that the Japanese imperialists set up "Residency-General", a machinery for colonial fascist rule over Korea. 
					 But, the crimes the Japanese imperialists committed by wantonly violating the sovereignty of the Korean nation have not yet been settled despite the elapse of such a long period.
					
					 During this rule they steadily created "legal procedures" and conditions for turning Korea into a complete colony, while intensifying the suppression and plunder through it.
					
					 In order to intensify the above-said rule they massively brought Japanese troops, military police and police to Korea. Meanwhile, they forced the royal government to promulgate an "order banning entrance of the royal palace" aimed at blocking "free access to the palace" as a royal ordinance and made sure that the Japanese police took charge of "guard" over the royal palace and the king. 
					
					 The Japanese Cabinet decided on the "guidelines for dealing with Korea" aimed at wresting the right of home administration and dethroning Kojong on July 10, 1907. The Japanese imperialists staged a "ceremony of transferring power to crown prince Sunjong on July 20. They fabricated the "Jongmi Seven-Point Treaty" on July 24, completely depriving Korea of the right of home administration. 
					
					 They thus deprived Korea of her right to administer foreign affairs, full command of armed forces, judicial power and police power through the "Ulsa Five-Point Treaty" and the "Jongmi Seven-Point Treaty". On August 22, 1910, they cooked up the "Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty," turning Korea into a complete colony of Japan. 
					
					 They cooked up a "memorandum on entrusting judicature and administration of prisons in Korea to Japan" in July 1909, arresting, imprisoning and killing participants in the anti-Japanese independence movement en masse. 
					
					 In the wake of instituting "rules for security" by order of "Residency-General" No. 10, they forced the pro-Japanese puppet government to enact a "law on newspapers," depriving Koreans of the freedom of speech and press and harshly suppressing the anti-Japanese patriotic newspapers. 
					
					 Under the signboard of "promotion of welfare" they cooked up a "law on mining minerals" in June 1906 whereby they massively plundered Korea of gold, silver, copper and coal, etc. In November of 1908 they cooked up the "Korea-Japan fishery agreement," robbing Korea of all her marine resources. 
					
					 In December of 1908 they set up the ill-famed Oriental Development Company, plundering Korea of her land as they pleased. And in October of 1909, they set up "Bank of Korea," etc., putting the financial field of Korea under their control and totally blocking the development of national capital. 
					
					 Hirobumi Ito, who was the first "resident-general," saw to it that a "museum" was built under the pretext of "protecting" cultural treasures. He made sure that precious cultural treasures of Korea were massively shipped to Japan under various names. 
					
					 In August of 1906 the Japanese imperialists promulgated the "law on common schools," forcing colonial slave education on Korea. And in 1908 they instituted the "law on private schools," forcing patriotic and anti-Japanese private schools to close. 
					
					 They fabricated more than 60 "laws" and "royal ordinances" for two months from Nov. 18, 1907 to Jan. 18, 1908 for the purpose of strengthening their rule. 
					
					 They committed too many crimes under the above-said rule to count. 
					
					 However, the Japanese authorities are distorting the crime-woven history, claiming the Japanese imperialists started enforcing their colonial rule over Korea only after 1910. 
					
					 This is absolutely intolerable as it is a move to write off the period of their "resident-general" rule enforced before the period of the colonial rule by the governor-general of the Japanese imperialists in their history. 
					
					 The hearts of the service personnel and people of the DPRK are burning with towering anger and hatred for Japan as it has shunned the settlement of its past crimes, totally denying and distorting them. 
					
					 The DPRK will unfailingly settle accounts with Japan, the sworn enemy of the Korean nation, and force it to pay a thousand-fold dearer price for the blood shed by the Koreans.

articles.title: Koreans in Russia Meet to Commemorate Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
Koreans in Russia Meet to Commemorate Birth Anniversary 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Russia met in Partizansk City of Russia's Maritime Territory on Jan. 28 to commemorate the 70th birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					 Attending the meeting were heads of the National Cultural Centre and the Autonomous Association for Korean National Culture in the city and other Korean residents. 
					
					 Present there on invitation were members of the DPRK Consulate General in Nakhodka. 
					
					 Speakers at the meeting stressed that Kim Jong Il was the outstanding leader recognized by the world. 
					
					 With his Songun politics he glorified the dignity and honor of the homeland, ushered in the June 15 era of reunification and made great contributions to the world peace and stability, they noted. 
					
					 They expressed the will to work harder for prosperity and development of the homeland and national reunification under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Plutocratic Economy Censured in S. Korea
articles.content:
Plutocratic Economy Censured in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Han Myong Suk, chairwoman of the south Korea's opposition Democratic United Party, in a meeting of its executive chairmen on Monday criticized the "government's" policy of self-righteous plutocratic economy, according to south Korean MBC.
					 Branding the economy of the Lee Myung Bak "government" as the self-righteous economy based on exclusive rights, profits and operation centering on the plutocrats, she demanded an end to it.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korean Joint Military Maneuvers Slammed
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korean Joint Military Maneuvers Slammed
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korea-U.S. Combined Forces Command announced that it would stage Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers from February 27 to the end of April.
					 In this regard, Minju Joson Wednesday says in a bylined commentary:
					
					 Key Resolve and Foal Eagle are downright nuclear war exercises for aggression on the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean group of traitors has asserted that they are "regular defensive exercises" and that they have nothing to do with the situation, in a bid to mislead public opinion at home and abroad, but such sophism can never work on anybody.
					
					 It is well-known fact that the situation of the Korean Peninsula got deteriorated whenever the said exercises were staged.
					
					 The group wants "dialogue" in words but seeks in actuality to provoke a war against the DPRK. Its wild design to invade the DPRK with the backing of the U.S. can never be realized.
					
					 It is the unshakable stand of the DPRK to return merciless and annihilating retaliation strike to any aggressors' provocation.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean authorities are advised not to act rashly.

articles.title: U.S.-resident Korean Calls for Punishing S. Korean Conservative Forces
articles.content:
U.S.-resident Korean Calls for Punishing S. Korean Conservative Forces 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Koreans in the U.S. posted on its homepage an article titled "New Year 2012 is a year when the people will decide final stern punishment" written by Ri Hung No, an editorialist of the federation, on Jan. 18. 
					 The article said that corrupt acts committed by the Lee Myung Bak "government" and the "Grand National Party" last year are crimes unprecedented in the history. 
					
					 The present south Korean regime spoiled politics and economy, totally denied the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, guidelines for national reunification, and intentionally deteriorated inter-Korean relations, disclosing its pro-U.S. and pro-Japanese nature, it said, and went on: 
					
					 The candlelight demonstrations held across south Korea to denounce the regime for its humiliating diplomacy towards the U.S. and defeats of the GNP in elections proved that the people have forsaken the present regime and that the conservative forces can no longer deceive the people. 
					
					 The flunkeyist and conservative forces still make a mockery of people under the signboard of "renovation". What remains now is to sweep out them by the strength of the people. 
					
					 Those going against the peace and prosperity of the nation should be removed, the article said, calling for turning out in the struggle to severely punish the flunkeyist and conservative forces.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Condemned for Anti-DPRK Fabrication
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Condemned for Anti-DPRK Fabrication
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- With the true story about the sinking of the south Korean navy vessel "Cheonan" carried in some newspapers, people of the DPRK are expressing great indignation at the south Korean regime for having fabricated the incident.
					 In this regard, KCNA interviewed Kim Nam Chol, an officer of the Korean People's Army, and Ri Hak Min, a cameraman of the Korean Documentary and Science Film Studio.
					
					 Kim Nam Chol: Donald Gregg, ex-ambassador of the U.S. to south Korea, said the allegation that the vessel was "attacked by north Korea's torpedo" is unbelievable.
					
					 His remark is based on the Russian fact-finding team's statement that a net got twisted round the vessel's propeller blade, causing the vessel's collision with a mine.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime knew well about the happening, but abused it for confrontation with the DPRK and for the sake of U.S. strategic interests.
					
					 Those who used to charge the DPRK with such fabrications will have to pay dearly for their anti-DPRK campaign.
					
					 Ri Hak Min: Gregg also said if the real story is made public, the south Korean regime and the Obama Administration will get into trouble.
					
					 He compared the "Cheonan" incident with the Gulf of Bac Bo incident, saying the U.S. made a mistake.
					
					 In the 1960s the U.S. dispatched a warship to the gulf and committed a military provocation to expand the war against Vietnam.
					
					 The south Korean regime, as the U.S. did, is blaming the DPRK for the deteriorated situation of the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Controlling Media: Opposition Party
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Controlling Media: Opposition Party
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean opposition Democratic United Party condemned the "government" authorities as regards the resignation of the chairman of the Broadcasting and News Service Committee.
					 A floor spokesperson for the party on Jan. 28 dismissed the sudden resignation of Choe Si Jung as a trick to cover up the recently disclosed corruption and irregularities, especially the sale of a foreign exchange bank to a U.S. investment company.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak "government" will be punished for having delivered 5 trillion won to a foreign business, the spokesperson said. As a confidant of the present chief executive, Choe committed all sorts of irregularities since March 2008. But now he is trying to evade the blame for them.
					
					 Han Myong Suk, chairwoman of the Democratic United Party, said on Monday the blackest of Choe's crimes was that he triggered a serious setback of democracy by gagging the media. She called for foiling the Lee Myung Bak regime's attempts to control the media.

articles.title: China Dismisses Misinformation of S. Korea, Japan and West about DPRK
articles.content:
China Dismisses Misinformation of S. Korea, Japan and West about DPRK
 Beijing, January 31 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Chinese Ministry of Defence dismissed the misinformation released by south Korean and Japanese media that the Chinese army is likely to advance into Korea in case of "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula, according to the Chinese Defense Daily on Tuesday.
					 The Chinese Defense Ministry not only categorically denied the misinformation spread by media of Japan, south Korea, etc. about possible dispatch of Chinese troops to Korea but criticized it in strong terms.
					
					 The spokesman said it is "absolutely impossible".
					
					 Chinese military experts also said the report is baseless and absurd as Chinese troops' advance into Korea is impossible, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 It is clear that some foreign media sought an ulterior purpose when guessing the attitude of the Chinese army toward the "contingency" in Korea.
					
					 Not a few American experts assert the U.S., Japan and south Korea have limited ability to deal with the issue of the Korean Peninsula and no other country can replace China's role, while expressing hope that the Chinese side would play a more positive role in this regard.
					
					 As China does not keep step with the U.S., Japan and south Korea in concrete actions and measures, some foreign media talked a lot about this with their own calculations whenever an opportunity presented itself and even falsified and groundlessly slang mud at the former. 
					
					 This can be illustrated by the misinformation that the situation on the DPRK border with China got strained and Chinese troops advanced into the DPRK.
					
					 Worse still, some foreign media reported that there was a gunfight in an area along the above-said border, a plan for Sino-DPRK military drill was frustrated, China refused to sell its advanced  fighters to the DPRK in a bid to create differences between the two countries.
					
					 Their ulterior intention is to sow the seeds of discord in the relations between the two countries and cause troubles between them.
					
					 The aim of this misinformation is crystal clear.
					
					 Firstly, it is aimed to tarnish China's policy towards the Korean Peninsula and, taking advantage of it, criticize the present policy of China and pressurize it to keep pace with the U.S. and Japan and south Korea in the end.
					
					 Secondly, it is to serve the purposes of their domestic policies.
					
					 For example, most of Japanese media keen to spread the rumor on Chinese troops' "advance into the DPRK" are supported by ultra-right forces of Japan. The purpose of their rumors is obviously to weaken the influence of China on the Asia-Pacific region and increase their military expenditure.
					
					 South Korean media floated such misinformation in an effort to spy on China's policy line.
					
					 Huan Qiu Shibao published by the People's Daily on Jan. 30 exposed the falsity of the report about the "advance of CPLA into Pyongyang" spread by south Korean conservative media.

articles.title: Chinese Army Urged to Boost Advanced Military Culture
articles.content:
Chinese Army Urged to Boost Advanced Military Culture
 Beijing, January 31 (KCNA) -- China's Central Military Commission (CMC) has recently issued a guideline on boosting advanced military culture as the urgent need to build the army while maintaining its nature and qualities both ideologically and politically. 
					 The document gave the goal and key tasks to boost advanced military culture. 
					
					 The guideline noted that fostering soldiers' core values should be the basic goal for developing advanced military culture, and called for more mainstream cultural products that are close to army life in order to cater to soldiers' spiritual demands.

articles.title: Cuban News on Danger of U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises
articles.content:
Cuban News on Danger of U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Prensa Latina of Cuba on Jan. 27 exposed the danger of Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises to be staged by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces.
					 It said:
					
					 The U.S. and south Korea are planning to stage large-scale joint military exercises.
					
					 The DPRK termed the rehearsal a test nuclear war to invade it.
					
					 Involved in the Key Resolve to be staged from Feb. 27 to March 9 will be more than 200 000 south Korean troops and thousands of U.S. troops. Also mobilized in the Foal Eagle to be scheduled from March 1 to April 30 will be at least 11 000 U.S. troops.
					
					 These war exercises to be staged under the signboard of "defense" will screw up the tensions on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The south Korean forces suffered retaliation after they made firing at the territorial waters of the DPRK from Yonphyong Island in November 2010.

articles.title: 1st Conference of Communist Party of Cuba Held
articles.content:
1st Conference of Communist Party of Cuba Held
 Havana, January 31 (KCNA) -- The First Conference of the Communist Party of Cuba was held in Havana from Jan. 28 to 29.
					 Present there were more than 800 delegates.
					
					 The conference dealt with such matters as strengthening the party work, improving the work style of officials and ensuring close relations between the party and the masses.
					
					 Speaking at the conference, Raul Castro, first secretary of the C.C., CPC, said the experience gained in the struggle for independence and sovereignty shows that it is necessary to maintain the one-party system. Abandoning it is as good as giving up the Cuban people's strategic weapon of unity, he added.
					
					 He called upon the party organizations to mobilize the party members and people in a drive to implement the party's decisions.
					
					 A decision on the targets of the party work was adopted at the conference.

articles.title: 18th AU Summit Held
articles.content:
18th AU Summit Held
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The 18th ordinary session of the assembly of heads of state and government of African Union was held in Ethiopia from Jan. 29 to 31.
					 Present there were heads of state and government of the AU member nations.
					
					 The session dealt with the issues of ensuring the continental peace and security, promoting foreign trade among African countries, protecting environment and achieving sustained economic development.
					
					 Beninese President Thomas Boni Yayi became the new president of the AU.

articles.title: Russia's Efforts to Beef up Aerospace Defense Forces
articles.content:
Russia's Efforts to Beef up Aerospace Defense Forces 
 Moscow, January 31 (KCNA) -- Russia is putting efforts to bolstering the Aerospace Defense Forces. 
					 Russia has planned to build three factories for producing new missile defense system for the Aerospace Defense Forces, according to Vice Prime Minister Dmitri Rogozin on Jan. 28.

articles.title: Iranian Armed Forces Flail West's Sanctions
articles.content:
Iranian Armed Forces Flail West's Sanctions 
 Tehran, January 31 (KCNA) -- The deputy chief of Staff of the General Command of Armed Forces of Iran on Jan. 26 denounced the West's sanctions on Iran. 
					 The U.S. and the West seek to check the Iranian people's struggle and finally enforce their illegal demand, he said, adding that the enemies are seriously mistaken. 
					
					 The Iranian government will counter the enemies' sanctions by stopping oil export to Western countries, he stressed.

articles.title: Iran Warns West against Sanctions
articles.content:
Iran Warns West against Sanctions 
 Tehran, January 31 (KCNA) -- Mohsen Rezai, secretary of the State Well-Being Council of Iran, Saturday warned the West against its sanctions on the country. 
					 The embargo on Iran's oil export will bring damage only to Western countries, he said. 
					
					 The enemies should be aware that the sanctions will worsen the situation on the Persian Gulf and the Strait of Hormuz and the oil price will skyrocket, he stated.

articles.title: Abbas Accuses Israel of Foiling Exploratory Talks
articles.content:
Abbas Accuses Israel of Foiling Exploratory Talks
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas in a diplomatic meeting on Saturday accused Israel of foiling exploratory talks that were held in Jordan's capital Amman in January.
					 Abbas said the Palestine-Israel talks failed due to "Israel's inflexibility and its refusal to present clear visions regarding the issues of borders and security."
					
					 He reiterated the Palestinian leadership's commitment to a real, serious peace process "leading to ending the Israeli occupation and the establishment of the Palestinian state."

articles.title: Cooperation among Asian Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Asian Countries
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Bangladesh and India on Sunday signed an agreement on the construction of a power plant.
					 Under this agreement India will help build a power plant in Bangladesh.
					
					 Earlier on Saturday, Entrepreneurs from Myanmar and Indonesia adopted a memorandum of understanding on agricultural cooperation.

articles.title: Three Persons Die of Bird Flu in Hong Kong
articles.content:
Three Persons Die of Bird Flu in Hong Kong
 Beijing, January 31 (KCNA) -- Three people died of bird flu in nine days until Jan. 26 in Hong Kong of China, according to a report by the local health authorities on Jan. 28. 
					 Steps have been taken to prevent its spread.

articles.title: Protests Continue in U.S.
articles.content:
Protests Continue in U.S. 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Protests against exploitation and oppression by capital continue in the United States. 
					 Hundreds of protestors in Columbia Special District of Washington on Saturday came to streets to stage demonstration denouncing the capitalists' unlimited greed. 
					
					 Meanwhile about 300 people were arrested Saturday during a chaotic day of Occupy Oakland protests that saw demonstrators break into City Hall and burn an American flag, as police earlier fired tear gas and bean bags to disperse hundreds of people after some threw rocks and bottles and tore down fencing outside a nearby convention center.

articles.title: U.S. Beefs up Scheme for Military Attack on Iran
articles.content:
U.S. Beefs up Scheme for Military Attack on Iran
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is beefing up its scheme for military attack on Iran.
					 Washington Post recently reported that the U.S. navy has planned to rebuild warship into a depot ship to be used as a mobile base by its special task force unit and dispatch it to the Mideast region.
					
					 This ship is said to carry storm-boat and helicopter for the unit.
					
					 Meanwhile, Wall Street Journal on Jan. 28 reported that the U.S. Department of Defense seeks to remold GBU-57A/B in a purpose to secure the capabilities enough to destroy even the most solid underground nuclear facilities of Iran.
					
					 The paper said that the department asked Congress to pay additional expenditure of 82 million dollars on this project.

articles.title: Continuous Earthquakes in Japan
articles.content:
Continuous Earthquakes in Japan
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Earthquakes with magnitude of 5 and 5.5 jolted in succession Yamanashi Prefecture of Japan on Jan. 28.
					 Their epicenters were under waters off the eastern area of the prefecture.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Settle Its Crime-woven Past: Papers
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Settle Its Crime-woven Past: Papers
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Japan should clearly liquidate its past crimes committed against the Korean people as early as possible.
					 Papers in the DPRK Wednesday made this demand in bylined articles on the fact that on Feb. 1, 1906 the Japanese imperialists set up the "residence-general" (later "government-general") in Seoul under the pretext of Ulsa (1905) Five-point Treaty, fabricated by them, and enforced in real earnest their vicious colonial rule over Korea.
					
					 Citing data to disclose the atrocities done by the Japanese imperialists during the "residence-general" rule, Rodong Sinmun said:
					
					 The Japanese militarists hell-bent on the distortion and denial of history have let loose a string of reckless remarks that it is absolutely impossible for Japan to apology for its past rule over Korea, it was inevitability of history that Japan reduced Korea to its colony in the past and the Asian countries in future should follow the new "Japan empire" to realize the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere". Japan has reached the height of its impudence characterized by moral baseness and meanness.
					
					 The crime the Japanese imperialists committed by enforcing the "residence-general" rule on the Korean people can neither be erased nor hushed up no matter how much water may flow under the bridge.
					
					 It is the fixed will of the Korean people to settle accounts with Japan to the last and force Japan to pay thousand-fold price for their crimes.
					
					 Minju Joson said: The wrong attitude of Japan towards its crime-woven past is a blatant challenge to justice and human conscience. Japan is well advised to behave itself.

articles.title: Nepalese Paper on Korean People's Trust in Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Nepalese Paper on Korean People's Trust in Kim Jong Un
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Nepalese newspaper Gorkha Patra on Jan. 19 carried an article titled "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea".
					 The south Korean authorities and other forces hostile toward the DPRK supposed that there would be any "change" there after the passing away of leader Kim Jong Il, but exposed themselves to public disgrace, the newspaper said, adding:
					
					 After his demise the West had made various conjectures, but the Korean people's sorrow, wailing and grief, displayed during the mourning, clearly showed how deeply they respect and trust their leader.
					
					 The Korean people called at portraits of smiling Kim Jong Il every day to pay tribute and all Pyongyang citizens turned out in streets to bid their last farewell to him with tears in their eyes.
					
					 There has been no hostile action in the DPRK after the dear respected Kim Jong Un was acclaimed as the supreme leader of the party, state and army. This goes to prove that the Korean people are wholly respecting and following him.
					
					 It is one of examples for the DPRK's might of unity, which can be neither broken nor weakened by anybody.
					
					 Nobody can impair and change the Korean people's respect and trust in leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Korean people are firmly convinced that only when they follow his leadership can they reliably defend the socialist system chosen by themselves and achieve the country's independent progress.

articles.title: Indonesian Paper on Lunar New Year's Day in DPRK
articles.content:
Indonesian Paper on Lunar New Year's Day in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Indonesian newspaper Jakarta Post on Jan. 25 carried an article titled "Lunar New Year's Day in DPRK".
					 It said:
					
					 Though it was cold in Pyongyang the Korean people and children made bows to leader Kim Jong Il in humble reverence on the lunar New Year's Day.
					
					 This is the first lunar New Year's Day after the Korean people lost him.
					
					 Kim Il Sung Square was crowded with people laying Kimjongilias and other beautiful flowers at the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The streets in Pyongyang were decorated with such letters as reading "Year 2012" and "Congratulations".
					
					 The Korean people merrily enjoy lunar New Year's Day every year.
					
					 Schoolchildren's New Year performance was given at the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace.
					
					 Introduced on TV was how to cook rice-cake soup, a lunar New Year dish peculiar to Korea.
					
					 The Korean people are missing Kim Jong Il who worked heart and soul to provide them with joy of lunar New Year's Day every year, the paper concluded.

articles.title: DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Carried by Lao Papers
articles.content:
DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Carried by Lao Papers
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Lao newspapers Passason and Vatelao on Jan. 25 and 26 carried the part on national reunification of the DPRK's joint New Year editorial "Glorify this year 2012 as a year of proud victory, a year when an era of prosperity is unfolding, true to the instructions of the great General Kim Jong Il".

articles.title: DPRK FM Report Supported by Russia
articles.content:
DPRK FM Report Supported by Russia
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a statement on Jan. 26 in support of the report of the Disarmament and Peace Institute of the DPRK Foreign Ministry, which disclosed the crimes committed by the south Korean authorities to seriously disturb peace and security in Northeast Asia.
					 The statement censured the south Korean authorities for having aggravated the tension in the Korean Peninsula and driven the north-south relations to the worst phase.
					
					 It hoped that all the parties in the region interested in its peace, stability and denuclearization would take positive measures to minimize the aftereffect of south Korea's Lee Myung Bak "government".

articles.title: Birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated Abroad
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated Abroad
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A Guinean preparatory committee and a Norwegian joint preparatory committee were formed on Jan. 21 and 23 to commemorate the 70th birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the Guinean preparatory committee and Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, chairman of the Norwegian joint preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committees decided to organize various political and cultural events on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: En Pyongyang Naguib Sawiris y su comitiva
articles.content:
En Pyongyang Naguib Sawiris y su comitiva
 Pyongyang, 1 de febrero (ACNC) -- Llegaron el dia primero a esta capital el director general de la Sociedad Anonima de Medios y Tecnologias de Telecomunicaciones Orascom de Egipto, Naguib awiris y su comitiva.

articles.title: Firmado acuerdo Corea-Rusia
articles.content:
Firmado acuerdo Corea-Rusia
 Pyongyang, 1 de febrero (ACNC) -- Quedo rubricado el 30 de enero en Moscu el acuerdo de los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Federacion Rusa sobre la cooperacion en la rama de prevencion de pesca ilegal.
					 En la ocasion participaron por la parte coreana la delegacion del Ministerio de Industria Pesquera encabezada por su ministro Pak Thae Won y el embajador en Rusia Kim Yong Jae, y por la rusa, el jefe de la Agencia Federal de Piscicultura, Andrei Kraini y otras personalidades.
					
					 Pak y Andrei suscribieeron el documento.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun exhorta a trabajar como Dirigente
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun exhorta a trabajar como Dirigente
 Pyongyang, 1 de febrero (ACNC) -- En el editorial difundido este miercoles, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que todos los militantes del partido, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y otros habitantes deben crear, trabajar y vivir por el estilo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il teniendo presente que fueron formados por el.
					 El modo del Dirigente es el estilo original y revolucionario del siglo 21 que demostro su justeza e inagotable poderio transformador en las largas y duras practicas de la revolucion coreana, comienza el editorial y continua:
					
					 Exige impulsar la construccion socialista apoyandose en las masas populares y movilizando al maximo las fuerzas espirituales de ellas, y desplegar todos los trabajos de manera creativa e innovadora bajo cualesquier condiciones para producir incesantes saltos.
					
					 Abarca todos los principios de creacion y construccion a mantener en la actual epoca en que se construye una gran potencia prospera y los metodos de proyectar los trabajos e impulsarlos.
					
					 La idea revolucionaria del Dirigente se caracteriza por el espiritu de ataque que simboliza tambien su manera de dirigir la revolucion.
					
					 Su especial temperamento consistia en proponerse una meta y pasar inmediatamente a la accion para alcanzarla y seguir adelante para conquistar las nuevas metas mas altas.
					
					 Trabajar por el estilo de Kim Jong Il garantiza las victorias del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y la revolucion coreana y la aceleracion de la construccion de un Estado prospero.
					
					 Por otra parte, el rotativo Minju Joson subrayo que Kim Jong Il vive siempre en el pueblo coreano y su sagrado nombre y eterna imagen seran siempre la bandera de victorias de Corea.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia ejercicios militares EE.UU.-Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia ejercicios militares EE.UU.-Sur de Corea
 Pyongyang, 1 de febrero (ACNC) -- La comandancia de fuerzas combinadas Sur de Corea-Estados Unidos anuncio que desde el 27 de febrero hasta final de abril, desarrollaran los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle".
					 Al respecto, el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este miercoles senala:
					
					 Tales ejercicios son precisamente el simulacro de guerra nuclear contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					 La banda traidora de Lee Myung Bak dice que es un "entrnaminto ordinario para la defensa" y "no tiene ninguna relacion con la situacion" para desviar la opinion publica. Pero con tales sofisterias no puede enganar a nadie. Todos saben que los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle",  agudizaban la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					 La banda traidora de Lee habla tanto del "dialogo", pero practicamente, trata de provocar la guerra de agresion a la RPDC. Los titeres surcoreanos intentan realizar su ambicion de agresion a la RPDC bajo el amparo de EE.UU. Pero nunca podran realizarla
					
					 La inmutable posicion revolucionaria de la RPDC es responder con el despiadado golpe de represalia a la provocacion de los agresores. 
					
					 Las autoridades de EE.UU. y del Sur de Corea deben actuar con prudencia.
